item.title: Kubecon EU 2016
item.author: vincent.drl@gmail.com (Vincent De Smet)
item.description:
Trying to summarize the twitter streams so you don’t have to…

First, read the summary blog posts from people that were actually there:

  • corekube.com Day 1 Summary
  • livewyer.com/ Day 1 Summary

Day 1

  • Deployments manage ReplicaSets (Replication Controllers) based on template. Updating the template will act based on the diff, i.e. version updates will result in a rolling update (zero downtime)
  • Config Maps take the pod configuration out of the pod and let the kubelet provision it (either as env vars or config files mounted into the pod).
  • 3 ways that Kubernetes changes monitoring @sysdig
  • new docs website - Contributing, fixing issues, collecting bounties repo - $10k dollars allotted for bug fixes…
  • Extending Services & Ingress with nginx - in contrib
  • Kubernetes Volume plugins: slides @agonzalezro
  • Kubernetes meets finagle https://buoyant.io/ - slides @olix0r
  • Hypernetes - https://hyper.sh/
  • Kubernetes and the Potential for Higher Level Interfaces - slides @garethr
  • Container runtime explosion - http://kurma.io/ by @Apcera - slides
  • 1.2 milestones

  • CI/CD evolution with #kubernetes namespaces && Key takeways

    --maximum-dead-containers=100
--maximum-dead-containers-per-container=2
--minimum-container-ttl-duration=1m0s

item.title: Kubernetes Workshop for Docker Saigon
item.author: vincent.drl@gmail.com (Vincent De Smet)
item.description:
This is the first draft of a guide I wrote to set up Kubernetes with CoreOS on DigitalOcean. This guide is battle-tested through a workshop for the Docker-Saigon Meetup Group. During the workshop, Users may use this draft to follow along with the instructions until the guide has been officially published on Digital Ocean.

Attendees need to have:

  • A laptop (Linux/OSX/Windows should all be fine)
  • A console ready to go with access to git & openssh
  • A Digital Ocean account ready (if you do not have an account, feel free to sign up with my referral link)
  • Decent Docker knowledge
  • Some CoreOS / Systemd knowledge

I estimate it takes about 3 hours to work through the guide.
